metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3910 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high
metadata.Description:
Use After Free vulnerability in Linux Kernel allows Privilege Escalation.An improper Update of Reference Count in io_uring leads to Use-After-Freeand Local Privilege Escalation. When io_msg_ring was invoked with a fixedfile, it called io_fput_file() which improperly decreased its referencecount (leading to Use-After-Free and Local Privilege Escalation). Fixedfiles are permanently registered to the ring, and should not be putseparately. We recommend upgrading past commithttps://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/fc7222c3a9f56271fba02aabbfbae999042f1679https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/fc7222c3a9f56271fba02aabbfbae999042f1679

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 6.1.0-14.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-14.14').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was pending').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
